text: hi i'm leif reinert senior product
manager at aws hi i'm ethan medina chief
business officer of habana labs an intel
company today we are excited to announce
the general availability of our new
amazon ec2 dl1 instances powered by
habana gowdy accelerators to deliver a
powerful and cost efficient solution for
training deep learning models
every day machine learning developers
and data scientists are pushing the
boundaries of technology to create
larger and more complex models that
produce higher accuracy predictions
this complexity is driving up both the
time and cost to train and customers are
looking for ways to experiment train and
iterate on their models at lower costs
amazon ec2 dl1 instances are built to
deliver cost efficient training for your
deep learning models
when compared to the latest gpu powered
instances dl1 instances deliver up to 40
percent better price performance for
training models used in applications
such as image classification object
detection and natural language
processing
dl1 instances are powered by eight goudy
accelerators 400 gigabits per second of
networking throughput and four terabytes
of dedicated nvme storage
eitan can you tell our customers more
about gowdy accelerators and what makes
them the ideal choice for training deep
learning models sure
gaudi has been architected for
efficiency and scalability for training
deep learning models
the compute architecture is a
combination of a fully programmable
tensor processor cluster and a
centralized engine for matrix math
operations
the gaudi accelerators come with 32
gigabyte of high bandwidth memory which
makes it easy to port models from gpu
based instances
finally gaudi integrates 10 ports of
standard 100 gigabit ethernet on chip
enabling accelerators to be
interconnected directly inside the
instance without requiring proprietary
switches
higher utilization of compute and memory
resources results in improved
performance and lower cost
we have worked closely with habana to
enable customers training models on cpus
and gpus to seamlessly migrate their
existing models onto dl1 instances
synapse ai sdk the software for the gadi
accelerators is integrated with popular
ml frameworks including tensorflow and
pytorch so that developers can continue
using their preferred ml workflows that
they use today that's right leif
developers can migrate their models and
start training them on dl1 instances
with minimal code changes to their
scripts the synapse ai sdk also includes
programming tools that enable developers
to drive further optimizations to their
model performance through custom kernel
development
developers can go to the habana github
repo for the latest reference models and
docker files and to the habana developer
website for tutorials and additional
resources the easiest way to get started
with dl1 is to launch a dl1 instance
with deep learning omnis or deep
learning containers that come
pre-configured with the latest
frameworks synapse ai libraries and
toolkits needed to start training right
away for a powerful managed experience
dl1 instances are also integrated with
amazon sagemaker
there is also support for amazon elastic
container service and elastic kubernetes
service for deploying containerized
applications
with new ec2 dl1 instances you get a
high performance and cost efficient
solution for training deep learning
models and they are available for use
right away
